3.52.text: There's something I need to tell you-

11.55.text: You've been on a date? You met someone.

14.27.text: No, mum. Nothing like that. It's something I've been meaning to talk to you about for a while.

19.65.text: It's a big part of who I am and I just don't want to hide it any longer.

33.82.text:
I'm Green. I'm a fully paid up card-holding
member of the Green Party.

40.22.text:
Well I don't see how I could
have got that wrong.

45.76.text: I think on some level I've always known.

47.74.text:
But you can't be! You don't even look
Green!

52.76.text:
This is your fault, Joan. You
voted Labour when you were pregnant

56.92.text: She wasn't born this way, it's a choice!

59.78.text: I knew we should have confronted her when we found those copies of the Guardian under her bed.

63.81.text: It's Adam and Eve, Laura, not People and Planet!

67.91.text:
Actually the Garden of Eden is a
metaphor for taking more responsibility-

71.84.text: You're not even religious. Well, nor are you!

74.64.text: Look, maybe it's just a phase, Henry. You experimented with the Lib Dems at college and you grew out of it.

80.06.text:
It's not a phase, mum. It's something I
feel strongly about.

83.56.text:
How can you be sure? Have you even tried
voting Conservative?

87.58.text: I don't need to. I know what's right for me.

90.96.text: It's nice to be with a party who treats me like a human being for a change.

95.82.text: Maybe there's something else you could try before you decide for sure.

101.24.text: Maybe you just haven't met the right Tory yet.

103.44.text: Have you tried internet dating? Have you been to a singles night?

106.64.text: You may never even have children.

110.24.text: But they're be children of hippies, Laura! Hippies!

113.32.text: Have you tried just not voting?

115.40.text: Have you tried a sperm bank?

117.38.text: Mum, I don't understand what problem you think you're trying to solve.

122.76.text: And dad, I know you think it's a wasted vote, but I don't think that voting positively for something I believe in is wasting my vote.

131.54.text: There's nothing we can say to change her mind, Henry. She's a grown woman.

136.98.text: Well you could have chosen a better time to tell us than "Bring Your Daughter to Work" Day.
